description: From Middle French scrupuleux, from Latin scrupulosus.

adjectives.description: scrupulous (comparative more scrupulous, superlative most scrupulous)

examples: He is scrupulous in his finances.
Synonyms: meticulous, painstaking; see also Thesaurus:meticulous
He is a scrupulous businessman and always acts in the best interest of his company.

entries.meaning: Wrongly feeling guilt or anxiety about oneâ€™s morality; suffering from scrupulosity.
examples: Because I have a scrupulous conscience, I sometimes need to be reminded that not everything I do is sinful.
Synonyms: ethical, fair-minded, honourable, just, moral, righteous
